column4: Anyone know how to tell Ubuntu to stop freaking out about having to have su privledges to run things that use port 80?
run it with the proper user and group
is that like www or something?
yep, I think it's the www group, but I have to check
I don't have a pre-existing www, group.
what are you running on port 80, btw? just httpd?
hold on, I am sshing on another box to check the config there
even if that group doesn't exist?
at least lighthttpd runs on the www-data group
I am not sure how the group is created. I'd try it first by just creating the www-data group, and if that isn't enough I'd install and remove an http servere. Either apache or lighthttpd
you may even just want to keep the webserver anyway, since it will work better for static data. And you can reverse proxy on django
heh, at some point I'll learn apache ;)
